content.text: P is the point at which the string is attached to the cylinder
The distance between P and the centre of the bob is \(L\)
Adjust the adhesive putty and string so that \(L\) is approximately \(45 \text{cm}\)
Use adhesive putty to attach the string to the cylinder as shown in Fig. 1.1
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.2
Move the bob a short distance away from the stand, as shown in Fig. 1.2
Release the bob. The bob will oscillate
Determine the period \(T\) of the oscillations of the bob
Change \(L\) by attaching a different point on the string to the cylinder and determine \(T\). Repeat until you have six sets of values of \(L\) and \(T\)
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(T^3\) and \(L^2\) in your table
Plot a graph of \(T^3\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(L^2\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line
gradient =
y-intercept =

In this experiment, you will investigate the motion of a pendulum
You have been provided with a cylinder and a pendulum
Measure and record \(h\) and \(x\)
Calculate the area \(A\) of the card, where
Justify the number of significant figures that you have given for your value of \(A\)
The card has one edge of length \(h\) and another edge of length \(x\), as shown in Fig. 2.1
● Use the nail to make a hole close to one corner of the card, as shown in Fig. 2.2
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.3
Push the nail through the hole in the card
Fix the nail in the boss
Ensure that the card swings freely from the nail
Use the set square and the ruler to draw a vertical line on the card below the nail
Repeat using two more holes close to two other corners of the card
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(c\). Show your working
percentage uncertainty = .........%
Cut the card as shown in Fig. 2.5 so that \(x\) is approximately \(9\mathrm{cm}\)
Measure and record \(x\)
Repeat (a)(ii) and (b)(i)

where \(k\) is a constant

It is suggested that the percentage uncertainty in the values of \(k\) is \(5\%\)
Using this uncertainty, explain whether your results support the relationship in **(d)**
Describe **four** sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment
For any uncertainties in measurement that you describe, you should state the quantity being measured and a reason for the uncertainty
You may not need to use all of the materials provided
In this experiment, you will investigate the equilibrium of a card
You have been provided with a card
Describe **four** improvements that could be made to this experiment. You may suggest the use of other apparatus or different procedures
